item.title: Report E-2024050068
item.description:
Report E-2024050068

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) gallons of material released from four (4) 1-gallon plastic jugs. The released material impacted the trailer floor and Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum and the damaged plastic jugs were placed into one (1) additional 15-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050033
item.description:
Report E-2024050033

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail impacting the trailer floor that had been crushed by other freight. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent absorbents. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) 10-gallon poly drums. The damaged 5-gallon pail was placed into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050031
item.description:
Report E-2024050031

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: Logansport
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Gardner Transport Services, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 271868
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Our truck was hauling a load of EAF dust from Nucor Crawfordsville, IN to deliver to WSP, Logansport, IN. He was traveling westbound on CR 225. Another truck traveling eastbound on CR 225 was driving in the center of the road and ran our driver off the road, and then left the scene of the accident. When our truck was run off the road, the truck and trailer overturned onto the passenger's side in a ditch. Upon contact with the ground, the trailer body split and the manways on the roof came open released EAF Dust onto the ground. *Included is a copy of the police report which includes a statement from a witness who saw it happen.

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: GREENWOOD

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observe approximately two (2) cups of material released from one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and recovered the spent absorbents and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050029
item.description:
Report E-2024050029

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately 100 pounds of material released from two (2) 50-pound paper bags due to a forklift puncture. The terminal personnel cleaned up the released material and placed the recovered material into fie (5) 5-gallon poly pails. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050015
item.description:
Report E-2024050015

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately six (6) teaspoon of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail from a pin hole that resulted from being crushed during a load shift during transit. Dayton Freight cleaned the the released material and placed the recovered material and damaged pail into one (1) 7-gallon metal pail. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050017
item.description:
Report E-2024050017

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Superior Industrial Solutions
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: upon arriving in Elkhart, the tote of windshield washer fluid was found to be leaking from the valve. the cap had come off and the valve had become cracked open. the leak was stopped by fully closing the valve. the spilled material was assessed and cleaned up.
